images.text_verbatim:
MAIN FLOOR
SCALE: 3/16" = 1'-0"
1 HR F.R.R. INTERIOR FLOOR / CEILING:
0.6 PCF 2-5/8" T&G 2.5A-B (Time Assumed = 60 minutes)
2x10 PLYWOOD SCREWED & GLUED
1/2" GYPSUM BD
2 ROW BRIDGING
2 MIL POLY VAPOUR BARRIER
2 LAYERS 5/8" TYPE X GYPSUM BOARD (JOINTS OFF-SET)
BOTTOM LAYER IS TAPED & SANDED (60 minutes)
FASTENED W/ COURSE THREAD DRYWALL SCREWS @ 12" o.c.
PERIMETER & STRAPPING RUNS
MIN. 1" PENETRATION INTO WOOD
NO DUCTING IS PROPOSED TO GO THROUGH THE FIRE SEPARATION. ALL ELECTRICAL OR OTHER PENETRATIONS SHALL BE PROPERLY FIRE CAULKED OR OTHERWISE PROTECTED PER NFPA 80
INSTALL HRV IN THIS AREA ABOVE STAIRS
COVERED PORCH
SLOPED CEILING 5:12
10'-0" x 9'-0" OVERHEAD DOOR
L1
L2
C5
L5
L6
images.summary: This image shows the main floor plan of a building, detailing the layout of rooms such as the master bedroom, laundry, and utility areas. The plan includes dimensions for each room and notes on the installation of plumbing fixtures. Key structural elements include interior walls, plumbing fixtures, and electrical outlets. The plan specifies a 1-hour fire-resistance rating for the interior floor/ceiling assembly, with detailed construction notes on materials and installation. Section callout '1/A2.2' indicates a related section view. Element callouts 'L1', 'L2', 'C5', 'L5', and 'L6' identify specific components within the plan. The covered porch features a sloped ceiling with a 5:12 pitch, and the shop area includes overhead doors measuring 10'-0" x 9'-0".

images.text_verbatim:
ROOF PLAN NOTES:
1. PROVIDE VENTED SOFFIT AND 1 1/2" VENTING BETWEEN SHEATHING AND INSULATION (INSTALL MOREVENTS).
2. PROVIDE RIDGE VENTING OR ROOF VENTS 1/300 OF INSULATED CEILING AREA
3. WALLS SHOWN ARE BEARING.
4. PROVIDE PRE-ENGINEERED TRUSS DRAWINGS TO BUILDING DEPARTMENT PRIOR TO SITE INSPECTION.
5. VERIFY DIMENSIONS AND SUITABILITY BEFORE MANUFACTURE OF TRUSSES.
6. PROVIDE ATTIC HATCH INSULATED AND WEATHERSTRIPPED FROM CEILING BELOW INTO ATTIC.
7. ALL ROOF RAFTERS/JOISTS AND CEILING JOISTS SHALL CONFORM TO THE SPANS SHOWN IN OBC PART 9 TABLES A-3 TO A-7.
ROOF ASSEMBLIES:
R1 PRE-ENGINEERED SCISSOR TRUSS ROOF:
STEEL ROOFING
1x4 STRAPPING @ 24" o.c.
ROOFING MEMBRANE (PER MFG)
1/300 OF VENTS W/ UNOBSTRUCTED FREE AREA
INSULATION BAFFLES TO ENSURE ADEQUATE VENTILATION
5/8" OSB SHEATHING
PRE-ENG. SCISSOR TRUSSES @ 24" o.c.
c/w BRACING AS REQ'D.

INSULATION BAFFLES TO ENSURE ADEQUATE VENTILATION
5/8" OSB SHEATHING

c/w BRACING AS REQ'D.

1/300 OF INSULATION CEILING AREA
INSULATION BAFFLES TO ENSURE ADEQUATE VENTILATION
5/8" OSB SHEATHING

c/w BRACING AS REQ'D.
R4 STICK FRAMED OVERLAY ROOF:

5/8" OSB SHEATHING
RAFTERS PER PLAN
CEILING ASSEMBLIES:
C1 INTERIOR CEILING ASSEMBLY:
R50 CELLULOSE
1x3 STRAPPING @ 16" o.c.
1/2" POLY VAPOUR BARRIER
1/2" DRYWALL TAPED & SANDED

1x3 STRAPPING @ 16" o.c.
1 LAYER 5/8" TYPE 'X' GYPSUM BOARD (TAPED & SANDED)
LINER PER CEILING
C4 CEILING ASSEMBLY BELOW STORAGE:
BATT INSULATION (MIN. R50 TOTAL)
1 LAYER R22 & 1 LAYER R31

WALL ASSEMBLIES:
W14 2 HR F.R.R. INTERIOR STUD WALL (STC 36)
OBC 2012 SB-3 RATED ASSEMBLY W2d
2 LAYERS 5/8" TYPE 'X' GYPSUM BOARD (TAPED AND SANDED)
2x6 STUDS @ 16" o.c.
2 LAYERS 5/8" TYPE 'X' GYPSUM BOARD (TAPED AND SANDED)
FIRE SEPARATION EXTENDS TO U/S ROOF SHEATHING
SEE DETAIL 6/A3.2
W15 2x6 INSULATED RISER WALL:
1" RIGID INSULATION (JOINTS TAPED)

R22 BATT INSULATION
S6MIL POLY VAPOUR BARRIER

images.summary: This roof plan details the layout of roof trusses and ceiling joists, emphasizing fire separation and storage areas. The plan includes notes on the engineering and installation of roof components, highlighting compliance with manufacturer specifications. Key components include pre-engineered scissor trusses, attic trusses, and common trusses, each with specific assembly instructions. Ceiling assemblies are detailed with insulation and vapor barrier specifications. Wall assemblies W14 and W15 provide fire-resistance ratings and construction details. The plan notes the unconditioned nature of the storage area and provides dimensions for roof elements. Element callouts 'R1', 'R2', 'R3', 'R4', 'C1', 'C3', 'W14', and 'W15' identify specific components within the plan.

images.summary: This detail shows a shop wall section with a 2x6 sill plate on a sill gasket fastened to the foundation wall using 1/2" diameter anchor bolts at 48" on center. Concrete reinforcement includes 1 - 15M horizontal bar at the top. The wall is labeled with 'W11' and 'W3', and the floor level is marked as 'FL2'. The concrete is specified as 25 MPA poured concrete, with 15M x 18" dowels at 48" on center with 4" embedment into the footing. Footing size is per plan, using 20 MPA concrete and 2 runs of 15M rebar. The detail includes a 4" diameter weeping tile with sand screen and 6" crushed stone for drainage.

images.summary: This detail shows a foundation wall with various components and specifications. The wall includes a 2x6 sill plate on a sill gasket, fastened to the foundation wall with 1/2" diameter anchor bolts spaced at 48 inches on center, ensuring a 2-inch concrete cover to the anchor. The interior of the form has 2" x 6" rigid insulation. The foundation wall is constructed with 25 MPA poured concrete, reinforced with 15M x 18" dowels spaced at 48 inches on center, with a 4-inch embedment into the footing. The footing size is per plan, with 20 MPA concrete and two runs of 15M rebar on undisturbed soil. A 4-inch diameter weeping tile with sand screen and 6-inch crushed stone drains away from the dwelling. The section callout '3/A3.2' references this detail on the sheet.

images.location: Main Floor to Shop Firewall Detail
images.text_verbatim:
MAIN FLOOR TO SHOP FIREWALL DETAIL
SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
FIRE CAULK GYPSUM BOARD TO ROOF SHEATHING
2 LAYERS 5/8" TYPE 'X' GYPSUM BOARD TAPED AND SANDED (EACH SIDE)
OVERLAP DRYWALL TO ENSURE 5/8" 'TYPE X' CONTINUOUS AT WALL THICKNESS TRANSITION
NOTE: 5/8" 'TYPE X' MUST BE CONTINUOUS BEHIND ALL STAIRS, FIXTURES, PARTITIONS AND BULKHEADS EACH SIDE OF PARTY WALL
ELECTRICAL BOXES TIGHTLY FIT OUTLET BOXES TO BE OFF-SET FROM OPPOSITE SIDE STUD CAVITY ACOUSTICAL SEALANT AROUND BOX AND AT FLOOR / WALL JUNCTION
2x6 SILL PLATE ON SILL GASKET FASTENED TO FOUNDATION WALL W/ 1/2" DIAMETER ANCHOR BOLTS AT 48" o.c. ENSURE 2" CONC COVER TO ANCHOR
2" RIGID INSULATION ON INSIDE OF CONCRETE FORM
25 MPA POURED CONCRETE
15M X 18" DOWEL @ 48" o.c. w/ 4" EMBEDMENT INTO FOOTING
FOOTING SIZE PER PLAN 20 MPA CONCRETE 2 RUN 15M REBAR UNDISTURBED SOIL
6
A3.2
images.summary: This detail illustrates the firewall between the main floor and shop, featuring two layers of 5/8" type 'X' gypsum board taped and sanded on each side. Fire caulk is used at the roof sheathing, and drywall overlaps ensure continuity at wall thickness transitions. Electrical boxes are tightly fitted with acoustical sealant at junctions. The foundation includes a 2x6 sill plate on a sill gasket, fastened with 1/2" diameter anchor bolts at 48 inches on center, with a 2-inch concrete cover. The wall is insulated with 2" rigid insulation inside the concrete form. The foundation is made of 25 MPA poured concrete, reinforced with 15M x 18" dowels at 48 inches on center, embedded 4 inches into the footing. The section callout '6/A3.2' references this detail on the sheet.

images.text_verbatim:
TIMBER COLUMN DETAIL
SCALE: 1/2" = 1'-0"
BEAM PER PLAN
(4) 5/16" TIMBER SCREWS INSTALLED AT SLIGHT ANGLE MIN. 8" EMBED INTO POST
POST PER PLAN
SIMSPON BASE ABU1010RZ C/W (2) 5/8" x 6" HILTI KWIK ANCHOR INTO FOUNDATION (OR EQUIVALENT)
NOTE: ALL FASTENERS INTO TREATED LUMBER SHALL BE ACQ RATED.
(11) 16d NAILS EACH SIDE. (22) TOTAL
15M X 18" DOWEL @ 48" o.c. w/ 4" EMBEDMENT INTO FOOTING
FOOTING SIZE PER PLAN 20 MPA CONCRETE 2 RUN 15M REBAR UNDISTURBED SOIL
2
A4.1
images.summary: This detail shows a timber column with specific fastening and foundation requirements. The column is secured with four 5/16" timber screws installed at a slight angle, embedded a minimum of 8 inches into the post. A Simpson base ABU1010RZ with two 5/8" x 6" Hilti Kwik anchors is used for attachment to the foundation. All fasteners into treated lumber are ACQ rated. The column is further secured with 11 16d nails on each side, totaling 22 nails. The foundation includes 15M x 18" dowels at 48 inches on center, with a 4-inch embedment into the footing. The footing size is per plan, using 20 MPA concrete with two runs of 15M rebar on undisturbed soil. The section callout '2/A4.1' references this detail on the sheet.

images.summary: This image presents a comprehensive schedule of various building assemblies, including foundation wall assemblies, main floor assemblies, roof assemblies, floor assemblies, and ceiling assemblies. Each assembly type is detailed with specific construction methods and materials. For example, foundation wall assemblies like W1 and W2 consist of 8" poured concrete with rigid insulation and anchor bolts, referencing specific details such as 3/A3.2. Main floor assemblies include exterior walls with vinyl siding, Typar housewrap, and batt insulation, with specific wall types like W8 and W9 designed per building codes. Roof assemblies, such as R1 and R3, describe pre-engineered truss roofs with specific strapping and sheathing requirements. Ceiling assemblies detail interior and sloped ceiling constructions with batt insulation and drywall. The schedule provides a detailed overview of the construction specifications for each assembly, ensuring compliance with building standards and providing guidance for construction.

images.summary: This section view provides a longitudinal cut through the building, illustrating various components such as the covered porch, stairwell, entry, laundry, and cold room. The roof features ridge venting at a ratio of 1/300, with a ceiling slope extending into the great room. The storage area is unconditioned, with dimensions of 48" x 42" and a span of 16'-0". The section details the use of 1/4" T&G screwed and glued to the truss bottom chord. The foundation includes compacted granular 'A' and backfill with parent material. Key dimensions include a grade of 4'-2", a total height of 9'-1", and specific room heights such as 6'-9 11/32" and 8'-0 1/2". The section also highlights the use of minimum 4" polyurethane and compliance with OBC for stairs and handrails. Vented soffits and morvents are part of the roof assembly, ensuring proper ventilation. The section provides a detailed view of the building's structural and architectural elements, emphasizing the relationship between different components and their dimensions.
